question: 喧しい
sourceMnemonic:
You can guess this is an adjective from the <ja>い</ja> at the end. The meaning for the kanji is <kanji>noisy</kanji> and <kanji>picky</kanji>, so the adjective version is also <vocabulary>noisy</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>picky</vocabulary>.

This type of noisy can be just about being noisy, like a group of turkeys. It can also be a ""picky"" sort of noisy, when someone is being particular in a vocal sort of way.
sourceReadingMnemonic: My <vocabulary>noisy</vocabulary> mom has earned the nickname <reading>yak-a-Ma</reading> (<ja>やかま</ja>). "Yakka yakka yakka," is what my mom says about my life choices.
